adrFormatAddress: 2204 Frederick Douglass Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text: Harlem VistaSite provides exceptional eye care, and I appreciate that I don’t have to leave my neighborhood to receive a quality customer service experience. With every visit I feel well taken care of. Dr. Morris takes the time to explain every process and give me options on how to address my vision needs. Alicia is always friendly, informative, and a pleasure to work with. I’m glad I found this office.

text.text: Harlem VistaSite provides exceptional eye care, and I appreciate that I don’t have to leave my neighborhood to receive a quality customer service experience. With every visit I feel well taken care of. Dr. Morris takes the time to explain every process and give me options on how to address my vision needs. Alicia is always friendly, informative, and a pleasure to work with. I’m glad I found this office.

originalText.text:
Went to this practice for the first time for an annual eye exam. At the beginning of my appointment we confirmed that my insurance was covered and I had $0 copay. Had the routine exam done and was then asked to sit with the retailer, who insisted that I purchase contacts through their practice. When I declined purchasing contacts, they attempted to withhold my prescription unless I continued with purchasing their lenses. I then insisted that I only wanted to have my examination/prescription checked, to which they then claimed that, because I was "choosing" to not make a purchase, that my insurance only covered the exam IF I were to purchase the lenses with them.

After re-examining my benefits with my insurance provider, it was clear that this was not the policy and that they were intentionally deceiving me. I was charged an out-of-pocket rate for an annual exam that was covered in their practice AND confirmed to be within my insurance provider's network. Reaching out again, I very civilly explained the situation over the phone and attempted to have them reverse/remove the charge (to avoid filing a claim and reporting their business) and they refused to do so from their end, so instead I had to contact both my insurance and my credit card provider in order to have the charge disputed. FYI, both my credit card provider and insurance ruled the claim in my favor.

This is a shame because the Dr. Arielle Morris was very nice and professional, but fraud and malpractice by the staff is obviously unacceptable.

originalText.text: Dr. Morris was fantastic!  She gave me a thorough exam and really helped me to understand what is going on with my eyes.  She considered my lifestyle when giving me her recommendations for glasses and contacts. The staff at Harlem Vista was also fantastic with helping me select glasses.  It's such a great addition to the community!

text.text: Dr. Morris was fantastic!  She gave me a thorough exam and really helped me to understand what is going on with my eyes.  She considered my lifestyle when giving me her recommendations for glasses and contacts. The staff at Harlem Vista was also fantastic with helping me select glasses.  It's such a great addition to the community!

originalText.text: Extremely helpful every time. A neighborhood “mom and pop” store, not a chain - so they genuinely are neighborly. I’ve gotten three pairs of glasses with them, they make it very easy. Opticians are knowledgeable and super easy to work with. Very rare anymore that you find this kind of personable and proficient customer service.

Opticians are knowledgeable and super easy to work with. Very rare anymore that you find this kind of personable and proficient customer service.

originalText.text: Got my new glasses today and love them. Haven't had that experience for a while. Alicia took the time to really help me find the right frames, explained all the options on my lenses and we had a good laugh too. Dr Arielle was very pleasant on my initial exam.
